Interface Configuration

    StateDefinition

    public interface Configuration
extends StateDefinition
    Author:

      • Methods inherited from interface entropy.configuration.StateDefinition

    • Method Detail

      • setRunOn

        boolean setRunOn(VirtualMachine vm,
               Node node)
        Set a virtual machine running on a node. The node must already be online. If the virtual machine is already in a other location or state in the configuration, it is updated
        Parameters:
        vm - the virtual machine
        node - the node that will host the virtual machine. Must be considered as online.
        Returns:
        true if the vm is assigned on the node. False otherwise

      • setSleepOn

        boolean setSleepOn(VirtualMachine vm,
                 Node node)
        Set a virtual machine sleeping on a node. If the virtual machine is already in a other location or state in the configuration, it is updated
        Parameters:
        vm - the virtual machine
        node - the node that will host the virtual machine. Must be considered as online.
        Returns:
        false if the hosting node is offline or unknown

      • addWaiting

        void addWaiting(VirtualMachine vm)
        Set a virtual machine waiting. If the virtual machine is already in a other location or state in the configuration, it is updated
        Parameters:
        vm - the virtual machine

      • remove

        void remove(VirtualMachine vm)
        Remove a virtual machine.
        Parameters:
        vm - the virtual machine to remove

      • remove

        boolean remove(Node n)
        Remove a node. The node must not host any virtual machines
        Parameters:
        n - the node to remove
        Returns:
        true if the node was removed. false otherwise

      • addOnline

        void addOnline(Node node)
        Set a node online. If the node is already in the configuration but in an another state, it is updated.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to add

      • addOffline

        boolean addOffline(Node node)
        Set a node offline. If the node is already in the configuration but in an another state, it is updated. The node must not host any virtual machines
        Parameters:
        node - the node
        Returns:
        true if the node is offline. False otherwise

      • getSleepings

        ManagedElementSet<VirtualMachine> getSleepings(Node n)
        Get the virtual machines that are sleeping on a node.
        Parameters:
        n - the node
        Returns:
        a set of virtual machines, may be empty

      • getRunnings

        ManagedElementSet<VirtualMachine> getRunnings(Node n)
        Get the virtual machines that are running on a node.
        Parameters:
        n - the node
        Returns:
        a set of virtual machines, may be empty

      • getSleepingLocation

        @Deprecated
Node getSleepingLocation(VirtualMachine vm)
        Deprecated. use getLocation(VirtualMachine vm) instead
        Get the location of a sleeping virtual machine.
        Parameters:
        vm - the virtual machine
        Returns:
        its host, or null if the virtual machine is not defined as sleeping

      • getRunningLocation

        @Deprecated
Node getRunningLocation(VirtualMachine vm)
        Deprecated. use getLocation(VirtualMachine vm) instead
        Return the node that host a running virtual machine.
        Parameters:
        vm - The VirtualMachine
        Returns:
        The node that host the VirtualMachine or null if the virtual machine is not defined as running

      • getLocation

        Node getLocation(VirtualMachine vm)
        Get the location of a running or a sleeping virtual machine.
        Parameters:
        vm - the virtual machine
        Returns:
        the node hosting the virtual machine or null is the virtual machine is not in the sleeping state nor the running state

      • getRunnings

        ManagedElementSet<VirtualMachine> getRunnings(ManagedElementSet<Node> ns)
        Get all the virtual machines running on a set of nodes.
        Parameters:
        ns - the set of nodes
        Returns:
        a set of virtual machines, may be empty

      • clone

        Configuration clone()
        Shallow copy of the configuration. The state and the assignment of the element are copied but elements are not duplicated.
        Returns:
        a copy of the configuration

      • contains

        boolean contains(Node n)
        Indicates if a node is included in the configuration.
        Parameters:
        n - the node
        Returns:
        true if the node is in the configuration. {code false} otherwise

      • getTotalCPUConsumption

        int getTotalCPUConsumption(Node n)
        Parameters:
        n - the node
        Returns:
        the total consumption of the VMs on the node

      • getTotalConsumption

        int getTotalConsumption(Node n,
                      ResourceSpecification res)
        get the resource use of a node
        Parameters:
        n - the node to consider
        res - the specification of the resources of the vms
        Returns:
        an int equal to the sum of the uses performed by the hosted vms

      • getElementByName

        ManagedElement getElementByName(String name)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the element to return
        Returns:
        the first element with given name, or null.

      • addCluster

        boolean addCluster(String name,
                 Node... nodes)
        add a set of Nodes as a cluster. If a cluster with given name already exists, the nodes will be added to it.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the cluster
        nodes - the nodes that belong to this cluster. If null, no node will be added to the cluster, but it will be created anyhow
        Returns:
        true if a corresponding Cluster was created ; false if the cluster already existed.

      • addCluster

        boolean addCluster(String name,
                 Collection<Node> nodes)
        shortcut for addCluster(name, nodes.toArray(new Node[]{})
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the cluster
        nodes - the noes to add to the cluster, or null to add nothing.
        See Also:
        addCluster(String, Node...)

      • getCluster

        ManagedElementSet<Node> getCluster(String name)
        retrieve a cluster using its name
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the cluster to retrieve
        Returns:
        null if no cluster with this name si specified, or the corresponding modifiable cluster.

      • getClustersNames

        Set<String> getClustersNames()
        list the names of the clusters
        Returns:
        the set of names of clusters declared

      • delCluster

        boolean delCluster(String name)
        delete a cluster
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the cluster to delete
        Returns:
        true if a corresponding cluster has been deleted

      • getBelongingClusters

        Map<String,ManagedElementSet<Node>> getBelongingClusters(Node n)
        get the clusters a Node belongs to.
        Parameters:
        n - the node to get the clusters
        Returns:
        the map of name->clusters in which clusters the node appears.
